M51

Galaxy Group

The Local Group is the galaxy group that includes the Milky Way. It comprises more than 54 galaxies, most of them being dwarf galaxies. Its gravitational center is located somewhere between the Milky Way and the Andromeda Galaxy.

Local Group Galaxies (with distance in million light years) Segue 1 - Faint Dwarf Galaxy - 0.075 mly PGC 34176 - Elliptical Galaxy (Leo II / Leo B, Local Group) - 0.75 mly PGC 29488 - Elliptical Galaxy (Leo I, Local Group) - 0.9 mly NGC 6822 - Irregular Galaxy (Barnard's Galaxy) - 1.8 mly NGC 185 - Elliptical Galaxy - 2.3 mly NGC 147 - Local Group Galaxy - 2.4 mly M31 - Spiral Galaxy (Andromeda Galaxy) - 2.9 mly M32 - Galaxy - 2.9 mly NGC 205 - Elliptical Galaxy (M110) - 2.9 mly PGC 2666 - Dwarf Spheroidal Galaxy (Andromeda I) - 2.9 mly PGC 2121 - Dwarf Spheroidal Galaxy (Andromeda III) - 2.9 mly IC 1613 - Irregular galaxy, local group - 2.9 mly M33 - Spiral Galaxy (Pinwheel Galaxy) - 3.0 mly UGC 12613 - Dwarf Irregular Galaxy (Pegasus Dwarf) - 3.0 mly PGC 3792 - Local Group Galaxy (Pisces Dwarf), 3.0 mly PGC 143 - Dwarf Irregular Galaxyy (WLM, UGCA 444) - 3.7 mly IC 10 - Irregular Galaxy, Local Group - 4.2 mly UGCA 92 - Irregular Galaxy (PGC 15439) - 4.7 mly Note: Several local group galaxies are not visible to from my site in NE Scotland (Lat 57d 19mN). These include LMC, SMC, Fornax Galaxy. Carina Dwarf, Sculptor Dwarf & Phoenix Dwarf. NGC 3109 SubGroup UGCA 205 - Sextans A, Local Group Galaxy - 4.0 mly NGC 3109 - Spiral Galaxy, Local Group - 4.5 mly PGC 28913 - Sextans B, Local Group Galaxy - 4.7 mly Probable Nearby Non-Member Galaxies PGC 14241 - Irregular Galaxy (UGCA 86) - 6.2 mly NGC 404 - Elliptical Galaxy (Mirach's Ghost) - 8.0 mly More Information More Information

Segue 1 - Faint Dwarf Galaxy - 0.075 mly

Segue 1 (Leo)

Milky Way Dwarf Galaxy Satellite

Segue 1 is a dwarf spheroidal galaxy or globular cluster situated in the Leo constellation

and discovered in 2006 by Sloan Digital Sky Survey.

It is located at a distance of about 75,000 light years Segue 1 is one of the smallest and faintest satellites of the Milky Way.

Its integrated luminosity is about 300 times that of the Sun which is

much smaller than the luminosity of a typical globular cluster.

Observations however indicate its mass is about 600,000 solar masses,

which suggest that it is dominated by dark matter. In the image below the approximate area of Segue 1 dwarf galaxy

is indicated by large white circle. By comparison with reference image

(Keck/Deimos image) the visible stars that are understood to

lie in Segue 1 are indicated by green circles

Note: a longer exposure is required to detect more stars lying in the dwarf galaxy Annotated CCD Image (70% size, square root scale)

5 x 180s exposure (average combine), 3x3 binning, C Filter

2020-02-20 23:58 UT (#753140-44)

12" LX200R (at f/10.4) + ST-10XME

Auto-guided using TS 80mm APO, ZWO ASI178MC & PHD2 Segue 1 - Keck/Deimos Reference Image Credit: Marla Geha

Image has been rotated and resized to match own image Segue 1 - Unannotated Images Annotated CCD Image (70% size, square root scale)

5 x 180s exposure (average combine), 3x3 binning, C Filter

2020-02-20 23:58 UT (#753140-44)

12" LX200R (at f/10.4) + ST-10XME

PGC 2666 - Dwarf Spheroidal Galaxy (Andromeda I) - 2.9 mly

PGC 2666 / Andromeda I (Andromeda)

Andromeda I is part of the local group of galaxies and

a satellite galaxy of the Andromeda Galaxy (M31)

Position of Andromeda I is highlighted by white ellipse in image below.

The galaxy is very faint, but is better seen in a contrast enhanced image Annotated CCD Image (70% size, square root scale)

5 x 180s exposure (average combine), 3x3 binning, C Filter

2020-02-12 18:42 UT (#751003-07)

12" LX200R (at f/10.4) + ST-10XME

Auto-guided using TS 80mm APO, ZWO ASI178MC & PHD2 PGC 2666 / Andromeda I - Detail

Galaxy is visible as a faint smudge in upper centre of this contrast enhanced image Negative CCD Image (70% size, square root scale, contrast enhanced)

Image details as above

PGC 3792 - Local Group Galaxy (Pisces Dwarf), 3.0 mly

PGC 3792 / Pisces Dwarf (Pisces)

Expected location of PGC 3792 is shown by white circle

Trace of some objects are just visible within circle and these might be part of the LG galaxy

Total exposure : 35 mins

Image contrast pushed to limit in order to see PGC 3792 / Pisces Dwarf (centre) but it exposes

uneven sky background & smears on front of CCD sensor (particularly in lower left)

Bright star in lower right is HIP 4947 (mag 9.08) CCD Image (70% size, square root scale)

7 x 300s exposure (average combine), 3x3 binning, C Filter

2022-01-07 21:38 UT (#950087-93)

12" LX200R (at f/10.4) + ST-10XME

Auto-guided using TS 80mm APO, ZWO ASI178MC & PHD2 Image contrast pushed to limit in order to see PGC 3792 / Pisces Dwarf (centre) but it exposes

uneven sky background & smears on front of CCD sensor (lower left) Annotated negative CCD Image (70% size, square root scale)

Image details as above

(cross hairs adjustment -11,-3, radius 46) PGC 3792 / Pisces Dwarf - Reference Image Credit : Deidre A. Hunter, CC BY-SA 2.5
